website_summaries.verdict: Earns high marks for flexibility despite some durability concerns. Use it as a single-layer king mattress, a double-layer twin, or two single-layer twins to meet your guests' needs.
pros: Fastener and zipper combination helps prevent mattresses from slipping when stacked
Four inflatable air mattresses in one
cons: King configuration is a little small for king sheets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This has been my go-to for years and has really stood up to time and abuse. My 2 kids jumped on it repeatedly while camping so it had 2 tiny pinhole leaks in a seam. I fixed them with the basic glue/patch method and have used it without issue since. The zip together feature is great for tents because it doesn’t slide apart from your spouse. The storage bag included is a nice way to keep it all rolled up in one bundle.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Pulley

customer_reviews.title: Let me just say that the coleman mattress did not disappoint. As a precaution
customer_reviews.text: Actually read the negative reviews and decided to purchase anyway with fingers crossed. Let me just say that the coleman mattress did not disappoint. As a precaution, I decided to inflate it as soon as it arrived. No holes!! And actually really comfortable. We slept on the mattresses on a recent trip and was comfortable enough. I am so glad I purchased this item and would purchase a thousand more if needed. If you don't trust the critics you can definitely trust my review. No paid review here!! Good luck and happy mattressing!
customer_reviews.author: Stevieclean

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this item no matter how much the Coleman name used to mean.
customer_reviews.text: Today is the 3rd day past my Amazon return window closed. I just got back from a trip that took a few days and one mattress will not hold air. In a month we used these a total of 8 days on 4 different trips one stopped holding air. I got 5 years out of my old air matress before it started to lose air. I currently holds air better than the new one. I see I should have believed the negative reviews.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: I take them camping pretty regularly, and they hold up very well
customer_reviews.text: I've owned these mattresses for several years now and they're still going strong. I take them camping pretty regularly, and they hold up very well. I typically don't have to add air to them unless someone heavier has been sleeping on them. I also have yet to deal with any tears or leaks, so like I said, going strong. Additionally, and my favorite, you can stack the two single mattresses on top of each other for a very comfortable, springy nap!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An excellent classic
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of them so far. It is an excellent option for one or two persons. It is nice that you can configure it as two Fulls or a single King mattress. The valve works nicely with double seal. And the cover has a handle to carry it. I use it for visits at home and for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Manuel Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Very functional for camping.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Stays inflated longer than any other queen/king air mattress I've ever had - didn't have to re-pump in the morning. 2. Coleman pump fits perfectly. 3. Sheets and/or sleeping bags stay on top without wiggling around thanks to the suede. 4. Folds up pretty easily - putting it away isn't a battle. Cons: 1. That gap in the middle is uncomfortable if you roll into it. We slept sideways on the bed, with a blanket folded into the "dip." 2. The suede picks up every speck of dirt when not covered with a sheet - if you're using this camping, you may put a sheet over it before sleeping bags, just to keep it clean.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: This did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: The twins put together did not work. It rolled back and forth and was not comfortable to sleep on. I did not use the mattress until the second week in June 2019 so was disappointed that I cannot return it. It is mis-represented; It could work for the twins side by side.
customer_reviews.author: Mtn gal

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you buy an air pump!
customer_reviews.text: Inflates fast. We used it unfolded and it was surprisingly comfortable. Did make a lot of squeaky noise when we moved around but that may be because it was on a hardwood floor. My 98 pound Doberman slept at my feet and it did not lose any air for the two nights we slept on it.
customer_reviews.author: joejj

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware--Faulty Product
customer_reviews.text: Device failed with less than three weeks of use. Internal chambers on one bed broke (this is normal use, but 190lb adult...no jumping, etc.), causing a distended middle section that makes it completely unusable. The other bed was doing fine until one day it developed a leak. Again--normal use, no pins, rocks, sharp objects, etc. Just stopped working one day. Incredibly disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Blake G. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: other than that it's great when you have it stacked on top of each ...
customer_reviews.text: The is alright, I made the mistake of not unhooking when pumping it, so my straps on the clips are starting to tear off as well as the zipper. One thing though is even when cinched as close as it can be the bed still parts at the halfway point when spread out into a king size, other than that it's great when you have it stacked on top of each other!
customer_reviews.author: Shane Holiday

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect this as a long term investment.  Great when new but not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Too bad this covertable air mattress is the only game in town. I purchased this air mattress two years ago and it has only been used 4 or 5 times before one half developed a leak. I contacted Coleman and the mattress was out of warrenty so I'm stuck with half a bed which is fine for short trips but for my week long trips I'll be looking to get a convertible King size again.
customer_reviews.author: Zaphod

customer_reviews.title: It is ok.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this mattress, however it deflated kind of quick. And when flat - my 3yo son would get in between them and basically sleeping on the ground. It’s good but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Olesea

customer_reviews.title: Room for guests
customer_reviews.text: Needed extra sleep space for grandsons -- these inflated quickly and were very durable. In twin bed size, so happy they fit right beside a parent's bed! Eager to try them stacked, for better height.
customer_reviews.author: Merribe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two sets of these for camping. My husband and I used to use a queen air mattress, and had all sorts of problems--he'd roll over, I'd shoot up into the air--and when it developed a hole (after 7 years), we were both on the ground quick. The 4 in 1 Quickbed turned out to be "the best idea you've had yet!" (my husband said to me). I set them up for a week prior to use, deflating and then reairing every few days. No leaks. We used them as double high twins. They worked great--I slept very well (and that usually doesn't happen during camping!).
customer_reviews.author: Jedana

customer_reviews.title: Appreciate the 3 in 1 option
customer_reviews.text: Haven't yet used this product for sleeping however did test by inserting air with the recommended Coleman quick pump - easy - even fun... So pleased to have all the sleeping options available for different company needs...king bed, two twin beds, or a stacked twin bed. Very pleased and look forward to using...
customer_reviews.author: smslwm

customer_reviews.title: ... a couple of years ago for camping and absolutely loved them. The height is good when doubled
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these a couple of years ago for camping and absolutely loved them. The height is good when doubled, and the flexibility to zip them together to make a queen is terrific. However, one had to be returned after the trip due to a slow leak that left it almost deflated by morning. I received a replacement, no problem, but have not camped again until last weekend. Unfortunately, the same thing happened. Now, it's too late to return the mattress for a refund or replacement. I won't be buying Coleman again, I'm sorry to say.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn  Owen

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I travel quite a bit and sometimes stay with friends who have only queen beds or pull out couches. With my back issues, I have a problem in many of those instances. This product is compact and easily fits amongst our suitcases/coolers/etc. We can just grab it out of the back of the car and inflate it. Viola! Instant king bed. My husband and I are NOT small people and the mattress is very comfortable even for oversized people. It deflates and rolls back just like a sleeping bag very quickly. We don't leave home without it
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: almost really nice
customer_reviews.text: this is my second purchase of this airbed. the first one developed an 'air bubble' after a couple of months. thought i would give it another try. so far, no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great Air Mattress... very durable.
customer_reviews.text: After 7 years of being jumped on by my 2 children one side finally began to leak slowly. 7 years of abuse at the hands of small children was more than i expected from this inexpensive air mattress. At this rate it cost me about 7 dollars a year for a bed. It has served as a primary bed multiple times for 2 grown adults and had easily accommodated all 4 of us. It is comfortable and well worth the cost. I have recommended it to may. Note: Don't forget to buy the air pump. The Coleman 4d pump works great for an additional $15.
customer_reviews.author: BlondeTornado

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This mattress is exactly what we needed & expected. Very easy to unroll & inflate even for someone like me who tries to complicate the simplest of things. :) So far we've only used it one night but the next morning it was still properly inflated. Very easy to make a high twin, 2 twins, or keep as a large king. Super easy to also deflate & roll back up. It even has an attached bag that wraps around & velcros with carrying strap. Excellent value & quality. We are taking it camping next week so if my review changes I"ll be sure to come back.
customer_reviews.author: sollunaestelle

customer_reviews.title: Great set of blow up mattresses
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to blow up and let the air out of. I haven't personally slept on them but my 4 nieces and nephew and my own 4 kids seem to enjoy them and haven't complained. We haven't double stacked them, we've always left them side by side since we have so many kids staying over lol. This is a great set of blow up mattresses that we've had for months and have gotten plenty of use.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam G

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with these air mattresses!! I bought them in July and the clasps broke within the first week. One of the air mattress broke after only having for 5 months and the second one broke after 7 months. I am extremely careful with my air mattresses and treat them very well. This was a huge disappointment. I will say that I am impressed with Amazon's customer service and refunding me my money pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Chamboncito

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this junk!!
customer_reviews.text: Total junk. It lasted just long enough where I cannot return it and it is leaking from the valve, where of course it cannot be fixed. I bought another set at the same time as this set, so am now just waiting for my husbands side of the bed to start leaking. I will NEVER buy a Coleman anything again and would tell you to do the same. I am replacing them with something else, anything but Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Variety of uses  More like 3 in 1.
customer_reviews.text: Great variety of uses. Use as displayed for a single visitor; open for a couple; and separate for my two grandsons. Hint: I use an aerobed plugin pump for quick inflation (with a coleman battery pump adaptor). Battery operated options when camping. My math differs: 1. use as displayed; 2. open for a couple; 3 split to use as singles [I don't consider two singles separate as two uses]
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews on other beds like this, i decided to go with the Coleman bed - not only because of the reviews, but because of the name also. I've always had good luck with Coleman products and this appears to be no exception. We do a fair amount of camping - 5-6 times per year, and i've always been against an inflatable bed. However, now that we have a new Coleman tent, which is 12'x'12', we have room for this. It's awesome, easy to inflate and deflate, with the hand pump which is reversable. This is great, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: The best bed out there for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third set I bought. The first set was so nice that my nephew "borrowed" it. Then my sister wanted a set for her house for when my nephew visits. Finally, I decided to get a set to keep. This bed is very sturdy, the air doesn't leak even when left out for days on end. The best part is you can stack it for the older folks who prefer a higher bed or can be used as 2 beds when there are extra guests.
customer_reviews.author: ND from NY

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: I only used this once in my home for a 6 and 10 year old to sleep on these as 2 twins. The next time I pulled it out for an adult couple to use it as a king, one of the sides was leaking and one of my guests ended up on the floor. I guess I could understand it if I had taken it camping or something, but it never even left my house! JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Texanna Bossoff

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control, dud mattress loses air by morning
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one years ago, & it worked great for two years. I primarily used it for house guests. then pulled out to discover giant holes after it sat unused for months. because the pump was good & it worked well for years, I bought another. this second one turned out to be a dud. because my friend who used it was too nice to complain, I didn't realize this until it was past the return period. right out of the box, it doesn't hold the air and becomes deflated by morning. must be some quality control issues as another user had mentioned having a similar experience.
customer_reviews.author: bluepupae

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing defects
customer_reviews.text: Purchased at Amazon June 2014. Used once or twice a year and within the past year both mattresses developed leaks at the same place in the seam. Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W. Sullender

customer_reviews.title: Sent me a used one!
customer_reviews.text: The product by itself was a nice one but the seller sent me an open box with a spot on a air bed. I have a feeling that is a returned one or used one. I am going to return it and get it from another seller.
customer_reviews.author: online shopper

customer_reviews.title: I never thought air mattress is any good until I tried this one my friend lent me
customer_reviews.text: I never thought air mattress is any good until I tried this one my friend lent me. It's so comfortable and easy to use and store so I bought one for myself. It can be quite firm if you pump it to full strength. I never felt my back or hip pain when sleeping on this. The pricing is also very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: cl

customer_reviews.title: Great stacked, single and for 2 people.
customer_reviews.text: The air mattress is pretty good when its single or stacked up together but when combined (zipped up) as a king mattress it works good but only if 2 people are sleeping NEXT to each other. 3 people can't sleep on the king mattress, even a baby, not enough support in the middle where the 2 mattresses are joined together.
customer_reviews.author: Summit

customer_reviews.title: Completely flat within hours.
customer_reviews.text: Filled both brand new air mattresses to test before our guests arrived. One held air well; the other was completely flat within hours. Can hear and feel air leaking from one of the seams. Returning for refund. If you order this item be sure to test it out before you really need it.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Ann

customer_reviews.title: It works and it's versatile
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews complaining of defects on arrival, I inflated the 2 airbeds to test. After 3 days (without anyone sleeping on them) it has held the air pretty well. Storage flap is not quite big enough to wrap around both beds together and the handle is poorly placed, resulting in the beds' weight pulling on the closure strings (handle ought to be opposite the strings).
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Geis

customer_reviews.title: Great matresses
customer_reviews.text: I bought these mattresses for some guests that were coming over for the week. I loved that they could separate so my guests could have separate private sleeping spaces. I don't use the stacking option because I don't see any advantages to that, unless I was using this in the woods. The mattresses are surprisingly durable; there were times where I accidentally ran the sides along some sharp corners, but there are no signs of scratches. This is actually my second pair of twin mattresses because I like them so much.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Works great for some time
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable Very useful to have one big bed, two small ones or one small but tall After an year of use, it starts to loose pressure during the night Was impossible to find and fix the problem Bought another one and same behavior Now I'm trying another brand
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: My favorite air mattress because of its versatility
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through a few air mattresses in the past few years, and this is my favorite so far. My college friends and I just graduated, so we are frequently visiting each other in the respective cities. This air mattress allows me to have a twin, a king, or two twin beds when traveling. If any of my friends dont have room, we just separate the two mattresses, and everyone gets a good night sleep. The constructions is good quality, and works well with an airpump I already have. I highly recommend this for someone who uses air mattresses when traveling, for its utility alone.
customer_reviews.author: Eric G.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase for when my daughter has a friend sleepover. Comfortable enough for a night. One tip is that after you fill it, you need to top it off once more about an hour later. There is some displacement that occurs after it stretches out. So fill it an hour before you are going to use it. It's also much more comfy with both pieces attached. I wouldn't use this for a king. I would only use it stacked as a twin.
customer_reviews.author: Seeker

customer_reviews.title: one mattress burst during the first year of use. ...
customer_reviews.text: one mattress burst during the first year of use. And not permanent, we used it two times. First time for 2 weeks, second time one of them got a hole after two weeks. Now our guest is sleeping on the rest part. And we need to blow it up every few days. If you want a guest bed, choose a folding one, not blow up. I also owe another broken blow up bed which lived the same term.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise good, should come with a pump though but I ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the two complete sets I purchased had to be returned because the bottom of the double high twin bed would not hold air - unfortunately this happened while on our camping trip and was a real bummer. Otherwise good, should come with a pump though but I guess then when you buy more than one you would have multiple pumps - which could be OK when one stops working. We used a battery operated pump we got with another queen set at Costco.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: It's good for guest
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the queen size and have been using it daily for about three months and it still is holding up. Its comfortable, but not as comfortable as a bed. But it will do the job of sleeping on daily for my guest. This is a good buy since it is still up and I don't have to re-inflate it daily. Would give it a five if it was a little more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: tee

customer_reviews.title: versatile mattress
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty handy to have the option to make a king out of this. We are just using one mattress at this point and it is nice to have the second one incase we need it. It is pretty comfortable, although it does need a refill of air after the first night.
customer_reviews.author: jstew

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good though
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. I'm using it as a double-high twin bed. Lose air every 2-3 weeks. This is the first airbed I've had, so I don't know if that's usual or if it should be worrying me. Sorry! I wish there were MORE holes/indentations/whatever-you-call-them across the top though. There are so few of them that elbows and knees tend to get caught in them--sometimes in uncomfortable ways. Pretty good though.
customer_reviews.author: Skycladlilith SaintMartha

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: This was a great solution to temporarily being without a bed during a move. It will also double nicely as an extra twin guest bed once we are settled again. I will give it four stars until I see how long it lasts; my last coleman mattress was great but only lasted about 2 years. UPDATE: This mattress is 18 months old and still going strong. We use it regularly--both as a king and double-twin--and our guests are always comfortable and mattresses hold their air. For what it's worth, I have seen other reviews with mattresses that lose air, and I know Coleman's products can be hit and miss. But ours has been 5-star worthy when you consider the value.
customer_reviews.author: South Manitou

customer_reviews.title: Died quickly
customer_reviews.text: We got this because we were moving and thought we would just camp out on the floor over renting a hotel the few days our furniture was already out of the house. Worked great for about a week then one of the mattresses would go flat within a matter of an hour. Don't get me wrong, any air mattress you get is going to slowly lose air and need some repumping before you use it again. But this was ridiculous. I've had it only 2 months and I'm going to contact amazon for a return.
customer_reviews.author: Lillyjumper192

customer_reviews.title: Overflow Guest Mattress
customer_reviews.text: This Coleman mattress is sized as 2 twins or one king and it is just that. It is comfortable and stays inflated even after several days. We used ours on carpeted floor in our home during the holidays with more guests than beds. The mattress was quick to inflate with a battery operated air pump (sold separately) and quite sturdy. I'm sure it will be used for camping in the future (ugh!)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This system worked out great for my husband and I
customer_reviews.text: This system worked out great for my husband and I. We are fairly large sized people and have a difficult time getting up and down off of the floor. We bought two of these mattress sets and opened them up to make a king sized mattress that was double height. Sleeping on them was very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Moore

customer_reviews.title: The other was fine for the first night
customer_reviews.text: ordered this set a year ago for a camping trip that was then cancelled. Now, a year later, I opened the box and took them on my first camping night- immediately one deflated after blowing it up . The other was fine for the first night , second night it too deflated. I can't return them because too much time has passed... $50 for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: debbie

customer_reviews.title: Good sleep, no need to count sheep.
customer_reviews.text: Only needed it for one night but it did the job perfectly. We knew we weren't going to have a mattress after the move for a day or two and now that our current mattress is here, we have a nice backup or a place for guests to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Jezowski

customer_reviews.title: Good at first, but overall bummed
customer_reviews.text: Air mattresses came as described. Very cool that you can use in several different ways. However, on first use, we found one of the beds leaked and since it was our first use we thought we could exchange it but found out we only had 30 days from date of order to return/replace. That is beyond frustrating and wish policy was more customer friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wonderful

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for camping and other things also!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this mattress for months on top of my normal bed. While I enjoy these mattresses out camping, it is also the most comfortable thing in the world when you have a bad back. I fill it almost full laying it on top of my normal mattress so nothing pokes into my spine. I sleep on air, and its a wonderful solution for me.
customer_reviews.author: Browser

customer_reviews.title: good deal
customer_reviews.text: The twin beds stacked together are lower than the raised aerobed, but were very comfortable. Both stayed inflated and were comfortable for even the middle-aged person to nap on...liked how it rolls up into its own little bundle. Plan to take these to grandma's house in a few weeks. Great for kids, and you can tuck in a flat sheet for a bottom sheet. Coleman pump (plug in) was loud but did the job, and all of it stuffs behind the LR couch...
customer_reviews.author: Nolaprof

customer_reviews.title: Handy inflatable mattress
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of being able to have 2 twins or 1 double thick Twin bed. Seems to be quality construction. Like the attached pouch to roll the bed up in when not in use. Only reason I give it a 4 is that it needs to be top off with a little more air each day or 2, but then which inflatable doesn't. Used it on 4 occasions now and it has done the job each time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rackouski

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile and durable airbed - adjustable sizes & firmness
customer_reviews.text: Works very well - as other reviewers have mentioned adjusting after the initial inflation will help maintain the firmness (or softness, if you want to let more air out). We love the versatility of being able to stack the two mattresses on top (which we found to be softer) or have the two side by side, when you have more than one guest over. Stores away very easily in a small cube & you would hardly notice it otherwise! Just to note it does not come with an air pump, so best be advised purchasing one on Amazon or elsewhere (we bought a battery powered air pump, as suggested for combining on Amazon)
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great airbed
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Please note that its tricky at first. Some tips before you sleep on it. First inflate all the way until its kind of hard, lie down and test it, do this a few hours before you are planning to sleep on it. Ok, now you ready to sleep and its probably still kind of hard, lie on top of the side of the mattress that you intend to sleep and deflate it a bit while your on top of it. You'll feel the air pockets adjusting to your weight. In this mattress firmness doesnt equal comfortless. Just follow this tips and you'll sleep great!
customer_reviews.author: Nats

customer_reviews.title: Just what I expected
customer_reviews.text: The bed is good . I do recommend to use the AIRHEAD AHP-12HP High Pressure Air Pump 12 Volt . It fills the quickbed "quickly" and with good pressure , so you don't have to slip in a fluffy bed . In a tent you can fit 3 people in the bed , but make sure you lay down across the connecting part of the beds and no parallel to them, otherwise the person in the middle will have a miserable night
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Escobar

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been using these for over a year now in our camper. So far we’ve not had any problems and like that we can each dictate the firmness of our side of the bed...like our sleep number bed at home...
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Howell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This bed was delivered quickly! I was worried because I needed it 2 days after I ordered it. As soon as we received it we filled it with air to see if it would hold (there were a few complaints about this) and it was in excellent condition. We took it camping with us over the 4th. I adjusted my side of the bed, my husband slept on the other side, and slept just like I would have at home. A wonderful product and a great idea!
customer_reviews.author: ranee

customer_reviews.title: This is so convenient for the long term with all ...
customer_reviews.text: This is so convenient for the long term with all the different ways to use it. We have used it for extra guests, camping in multiple ways. It could be a little closer in the middle when it is in the king bed mode. Hopefully you have a "coleman brand' air blower for car and house because that is what you will need - another air pump I had did not work for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Quick Bed
customer_reviews.text: The Coleman folks really know how to build out door product....I am currently in Afghanistan, and the normal mattress's available here leave much to be desired...I had the first night of uninterupted sleep last night on one of the two coleman mattress's that I received from your establishment......for those of you deploying or contracting outside the Normal part of the world.....this would be great KIT to include in your deployment package
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: NO PUMP INCLUDED/ REQUIRES SEPARATE PUMP.  Inflation issues exist.
customer_reviews.text: NO PUMP INCLUDED/ REQUIRES SEPARATE PUMP. Pump is pictured in listing, so many models include built-in pumps, and nothing in the Amazon listing alerts buyers to this. Similar inflation problems as others, out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: 1kenthomas

customer_reviews.title: go to walmart, they have better warranty and return policy
customer_reviews.text: half a year and about twenty uses, two of the internal links (?) broke and now there's huge bump in middle, believe me, there's no way to lie down comfortably around that thing.
customer_reviews.author: grzbiet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for guests when you have sleepovers
customer_reviews.text: It could be stacked as a raised twin bed for one person or separate into twin beds for 2 separate people. Perfect for guests when you have sleepovers. The air mattress pump is sold separately though. Great purchase, I am pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Camille Ladson

customer_reviews.title: Best one I've owned!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit apprehensive but was so glad I made this choice. Comfortable, sturdy and my grand had great fun sleeping on it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Newbrax

customer_reviews.title: Great Bed
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. One of the matresses got a hole in it. Of course, I didn't know it until I was at the campsite. Good thing is you still have one mattress if one is messed up, so I wasn't sleeping on the ground. I still have the other but like the double high feeling. It feels like you are on a real bed in your tent. The new version has a different kind of clip to hold them together and I really liked the old one better, but they do stay together and not slide. Plus, if you need two singles you can separate them. I would recommend this bed.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: We've given this item several chances over the last several ...
customer_reviews.text: We've given this item several chances over the last several years to sleep our young children and guests. Twice, the item arrived with one of the beds already having a hole in it. Another bed had the valve break off after a short time, and our final one just did its inevitable sinking act. Avoid leaving the beds in a garage or car. I suspect the temperature changes may have played a role. I keep wanting to give Coleman one more chance, but I just can't anymore.
customer_reviews.author: lthom

customer_reviews.title: Deflated the first time we took it out. Buy ...
customer_reviews.text: Deflated the first time we took it out. Buy Teton Sports comfort pad, cost you a lot more but it won't deflate and lasts a long time. Mine is still working 2 years later with no issues. Don't Buy the Coleman junk airbed.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Cardoza

customer_reviews.title: No pump included
customer_reviews.text: The one problem is i did not notice i needed to buy a pump separately. Make sure to order a pump
customer_reviews.author: Lynnett Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to inflate and deflate
customer_reviews.text: Nice becuase it was easy to inflate and deflate. But I did have to inflate every night camping, which I think is normal so nothing special there. My one complaint is that when the two mattresses are laying side by side and connected, there will still be a gap in the middle. So if you are sleeping in the middle, or next to someone, you will sink into the valley.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: great so far
customer_reviews.text: The beds are great so far. They have had only about 14 days of use for guests. They held air great. I expect to use them more as twin beds then putting them side by side as a king. My non-coleman air pump worked just fine. I like that there are direction on the black wrapping part with how to roll up and wrap, very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Lenore

customer_reviews.title: SMALL
customer_reviews.text: NOT Twin/ King..... it's a few inches shy of twin size when used as twin. When you unfold it for "king" it is simply twice the size it was in "twin" set up. In spite of it being small, It actually hold air well and is rather comfortable for a blow up bed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile product!
customer_reviews.text: My family recently went camping and required air mattresses for four people. Our tent is large enough to fit two queens; however, we occasionally have a few extra guests in our house and would like to have a king-sized mattress. We ordered two of these which are very versatile! For camping, we use them as four separate twins and can attach and stack them at home for a guest king. I must admit, I was really worried that they wouldn't keep air or that we might have had some "duds" on our trip. They held air the entire weekend and were so comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL Purchase. Worst bed I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: This is not a king sized bed. This does not work as a king sized bed. My boyfriend and I took these camping. We had to use as separate twin beds, since the zipper didn't hold the bed together. I am 5'4 and the bed barely fit me. Also, the bed deflated within six hours of inflating it. Easily the worst bed I've ever taken camping.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Lousy bed
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly designed. Straps to hold the two beds together do not work. I returned this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Corber

customer_reviews.title: As advertised and no leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as I had two visitors coming for a short stay this month and one person coming in next month. I was a little hesitant after some of the reviews mentioned that they got mattresses that leaked and would quickly go flat. After one week both mattresses held air and required no patching. Happy I did not pay twice as much for some of the higher reviewed items. Get a pump...I do not think these were truly meant for manual inflation.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Klein

customer_reviews.title: Great bed
customer_reviews.text: My family has had our fair share of blow up mattresses and I have to say this is one of the better ones we've owned. Serves multiple situations and have had great compliments of how it sleeps. Have used it camping as well as for extra bed for daughters' sleepovers. Even if I hadn't bought it for a super deal, I would have paid full price.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleyangel

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought this mattress for our pop-up camper. We love it, it fits perfect, and it fills up quick with our battery operated air pump. We've used it several times and have had no problems with it at all. Holds air great for us (we're not light weight people either)
customer_reviews.author: lucky1

customer_reviews.title: works as expected from coleman
customer_reviews.text: We have used this 3 or 4 times in the past year. Works well either as single or double stacked. Stores well. Would recommend this. Would be nice to have an adapter for the compressor, but that wasn't advertised so no marks off. you can use a backflow cork available at any wine/beer making store. It is basically a rubber stopper with a hole in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: ramrog

customer_reviews.title: Forget it
customer_reviews.text: This would be fine if used as a single but when you try to use it as a queen you both roll to the center. It was really uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: debra standridge

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: One of the two air mattresses doesn't hold the air and very slowly deflates. I checked for air leaks without any success.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great Mattresses
customer_reviews.text: Have used these for years when extra company spends the night. They last a long time and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Celtic Red

customer_reviews.title: Great for our teenage kids
customer_reviews.text: Our kids are getting too big to sleep on a sleeping bag on the floor when we have big family gatherings. This worked our great for us. Fast and easy to set up and put away. Small and light enough to not be a hassle to pack or store. We used them for a week and did not have to refill at all. Kids slept comfortably. I didn't sleep on them but they felt comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian in Boston

customer_reviews.title: Respectable but two warnings
customer_reviews.text: It's a good double-mattress. Together they make for a thick bed though of course, without extra padding, you'll feel the grooves in the mattress. One warning I have is that this does not come with an air pump. A second warning is that even with the straps, if you can't pull them tight, the mattresses will slip a little on one another. Very use-able though for indoors and versatile. Quite a luxurious air mattress. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Luella Fu

customer_reviews.title: Very happy sleeping on a Coleman
customer_reviews.text: We needed these to visit family when our old Coleman queen size started leaking. Having two units that make into one large unit works much better for us that one giant one. So this design is much more to our liking than the old single unit. The quaity is good too. I got it at a discount by ordering it from a secondary dealer but it was good a new and half the price.
customer_reviews.author: W. L. Offutt

customer_reviews.title: Great at everything except holding air
customer_reviews.text: Well they sure look nice, and they've got a nice suede-like surface, and they inflate easily. In fact they would be everything I would want in an air mattress except for the glaring flaw of not holding air in. BOTH deflated noticeably without anybody even laying on them within a couple of hours and were nearly flat on the floor by morning. I got some tent seam sealer and tried applying it around the valve area with no noticeable effect. Waste of money and the warranty already expired. Would give zero stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: CNH

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality
customer_reviews.text: These are so nice to have on hand for overnight visitors as well as to tent camp with for those of us with bad backs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Best Airbed Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best airbed we've ever had. Love that it can fold into a twin for space saving and extra thickness, but the key is that it does NOT lose air like so many airbeds do! There's nothing worse than waking up on a flat airbed. We've had it for about a year and a half now, and it still works great. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: The other one is still fine after two more uses as an extra bed indoors
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two sets. I tested them out before our backyard camping with friends. One mattress of one of the sets leaked during our camp out. Luckily I was using them doubled and did not end up on the ground. I returned the set with defective mattress and was refunded. The other one is still fine after two more uses as an extra bed indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Peace

customer_reviews.title: Makes sleeping on our camping trips much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this on several camping trips now over the past 2 years and it has worked great. Getting higher off the ground is a big plus as well. Beats sleeping on a cot and is a lot easier to pack. Would recommend to anyone looking at an inflatable bed.
customer_reviews.author: MMailloux

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and good quality
customer_reviews.text: I love that this set of matresses zip together to STAY together, it folds in half so during the day there is more space inside our tent to get around, the large air ports aide in inflating these very quickly with our rechargeable pump, they rolll up well and stay together with the black drawstring "bag" that is connected (it doesn't get lost!). The weight of the plastic is good, felt side is nice. No complaints here, glad I purchased it and it's worked out to be just want I needed.
customer_reviews.author: mama2bigc

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This has been my go to when guest stop buy. I have doubled it up to make a tall bed, and laid it out to accommodate a couple and separated them for the grand-kids. Each time they were easy to fill up and to empty, along with being easy to roll and stuff into the bag that is attached.
customer_reviews.author: jcthatsme4

customer_reviews.title: Money Totally Wasted
customer_reviews.text: What a huge waste of money. The very first time I used it, it leaked. Within 3 hours it was flat as a pancake. Another piece of junk made in China sold buy Coleman. Next to impossible to repair. If you buy this China junk, beware/be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Ugly Dog

customer_reviews.title: I bought these for camping and I love that I have the option of it being for ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for camping and I love that I have the option of it being for either one or two! I was TOTALLY comfortable on the one air mattress. When putting two together, they do have a slight shift but I still think they are great. Yes, I would buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: jtay

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed with the thickness of each mattress
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with the thickness of each mattress. The pic makes them look thicker than they really are - they are only about 4" thick.
customer_reviews.author: SW Engineer

customer_reviews.title: It's a basic bed.
customer_reviews.text: Basically what you'd expect. It can be 2 twins stacked, 2 twins separately, or a king if you place them side by side. After 2 years of usage, on of them has popped.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor B

customer_reviews.title: Great concept
customer_reviews.text: I have used this about 6 times now for overnight guests, who sleep on it for 1-2 nights. It stays inflated, though you probably will need to add a bit more air after the first filling as it "settles". The size is convenient for me as I have a SMALL apartment and I can use this in my living room and only have to move coffee table out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Ray

customer_reviews.title: great night of sleeping
customer_reviews.text: Fits in my tent as a single twin. great night of sleeping, instead of fighting with the air mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Loli

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed. I used this the first time it was ...
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this again; very disappointed. I used this the first time it was great. One month later on the next trip the bottom mattress would not hold the air. Too late to return to Amazon. Coleman says they will send a replacement, we'll see how that one holds up. Too bad Coleman doesn't care about their reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Uniquely Deb;s

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to fill
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and easy to fill...even with a foot pump! I love that you can stack these two to make a higher twin bed. I keep this in our nursery as our first son sleeps in our room. I've filled the bed once I got home and haven't had to repump any air into it for 6 days now!
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! Used it for a road trip (inflated it ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Used it for a road trip (inflated it in the back of my Jeep) and for camping. I also had to use it when I had to sleep in the basement since the upper floors were boiling hot from a failing HVAC.
customer_reviews.author: D-man

product_meta.title: Coleman 4 in 1 Quickbed Twin/King Air Bed
product_meta.description: The Coleman QuickBed 4-N-1 Airbed features an innovative design that lets you choose the best way to sleep. Great for use while camping outdoors or as an extra bed in the house, this inflatable mattress has a versatile convertible design that allows it to be positioned in a variety of ways. Use the air bed as two separate twin beds, a king size bed, or a double-high twin bed for extra inflated support. The QuickBed 4-N-1 Airbed fits standard king or twin sheets, depending on how it is being used. The air bed features 45 comfort coils for superior comfort as well as a plush top that is soft to the touch. Featuring durable PVC construction and AirTight system with Double Lock valve, this air mattress is guaranteed to maintain its customized firmness all night long. The integrated Wrap 'N' Roll storage system allows you to fold, roll, and store the air bed quickly for easy cleanup and storage.
feature_bullets: Versatile air mattress can be used as 2 twins, a king, or a double high twin
Double Lock valve for quick inflation and deflation; AirTight system prevents leaks
Soft plush top with 45 comfort coils for superior support
Approximate inflated dimensions: 73 x 40 x 6.5 inches; fits king and twin sheets
Designed for indoor and outdoor use

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
